title: Prosecutors charge Trump Organization with 15-year tax scheme
Takeaways from the Trump Org and Allen Weisselberg indictment
description: On Thursday, New York prosecutors charged the Trump Organization and its chief financial officer, Allen Weisselberg, with running a 15-year alleged tax scheme designed "to compensate Weisselberg and other Trump Organization executives in a manner that was 'off the books."

title: Richard Branson will attempt to beat Jeff Bezos to space
182 human remains discovered in unmarked graves near former Canadian school
description: A search has revealed 182 human remains in unmarked graves at the site of another residential school in British Columbia.

title: It's time to rethink 'one-size-fits-all' approach to mask guidance, expert says
description: With uneven vaccination rates across the US and a dangerous variant now spotted in all 50 states, a health expert is warning the federal government's mask guidance should be more focused, instead of a "one-size-fits-all" approach.

title: Analysis: Tax evasion is the go-to charge for Trump's inner circle
description: When New York prosecutors unsealed their indictment Thursday against the Trump Organization and its chief financial officer, it represented an important step after years of investigations: the first legal action taken against the former President's business.

title: Michael Cohen: This is part of Trump's strategy
description: New York prosecutors charged the Trump Organization, Trump Payroll Corporation and Chief Financial Officer Allen Weisselberg with 15 felony counts in connection with an alleged tax scheme stretching back to 2005, in an extraordinary legal development against the former President's namesake company. Weisselberg, the Trump organization and the Trump Payroll Corporation have all pleaded not guilty. Trump himself was not charged. CNN's Alisyn Camerota discusses with Trump's former personal attorney Michael Cohen.

title: He's making history at the Tour de France
description: Nicholas Dlamini is the first Black South African to compete in the Tour de France, riding for Team Qhubeka NextHash. He talks to CNN's Richard Quest about what it means to be a role model.

title: 'Rare' moment between Biden and Florida governor
description: President Joe Biden and Gov. Ron DeSantis (R-FL) came together to support the people of Surfside, Florida, after a condo building collapsed.

title: Undercover Exxon video reveals an anti-climate campaign
description: A senior ExxonMobil lobbyist appears to have unwittingly revealed how the oil company uses its political muscle to undercut climate action.

title: A woman's voice was heard from rubble during initial rescue efforts at Florida condo collapse
Vacation rental demand has gone crazy. Here's how you can still get a deal
description: Business was already booming for the vacation rental market before the pandemic, but interest has skyrocketed in the past year.

title: California high school stripped of basketball title after tortillas were thrown at opposing Latino players
description: A mostly white high school basketball team in Southern California has been stripped of its regional title after tortillas were thrown at a predominately Latino opposing team following a championship game last month, officials announced Wednesday.

title: 'This is no gift': McCarthy faces GOP resistance to serving on January 6 panel
description: • Analysis: The dangerous messaging from Trump's insurrectionists about who's American

title: Krispy Kreme is off to a seriously rough start as it goes public again
description: Krispy Kreme's cameo appearance on the public markets is off to a not-so-sweet debut.

title: Talks with Taliban are making 'very little progress' as militant group gains momentum, says Afghan official
description: As US President Joe Biden prepares for the formal withdrawal of American troops from Afghanistan, the man responsible for peace talks between the rampant Taliban and the official Afghan government is not entirely optimistic about the country's future.

title: Rising European anti-Semitism blamed on lockdowns
description: Hateful attacks on Jews and their religion have been increasing in Europe for years, but pandemic restrictions and the recent violence between Israel and Hamas have led to an upsurge, reports CNN's Melissa Bell.

title: Robinhood settles lawsuit over 20-year-old who died by suicide
description: Robinhood has settled a wrongful death lawsuit filed by the family of a 20-year-old trader who died by suicide after seeing a negative account balance of $730,000.

title: 12-year-old becomes youngest grandmaster in chess history
description: At just 12 years of age, Abhimanyu Mishra has become the youngest grandmaster in chess history.

title: Pinterest bans ads related to weight loss
description: Pinterest on Thursday announced that it will ban all advertisements related to weight loss from its platform in an effort to prevent content that could encourage unhealthy or disordered eating habits.

title: Pelosi says Liz Cheney will serve on committee that will investigate January 6 insurrection
description: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi announced Thursday she was appointing Republican Rep. Liz Cheney to the new select committee to investigate the January 6 attack on the US Capitol.

title: Supreme Court says Arizona restrictions don't violate Voting Rights Act
description: The Supreme Court on Thursday said two provisions of  Arizona voting law that restrict how ballots can be cast do not violate the historic Voting Rights Act that bars regulations that result in racial discrimination.

title: Meghan McCain announces her departure from 'The View'
description: Meghan McCain, who joined "The View" in 2017, has announced that season 24 will be her last. Watch her announcement on air.

title: Biden's massive global tax overhaul now backed by 130 nations and jurisdictions
description: The United States has won international backing for its plan to overhaul the global system for taxing companies, a huge step toward simplifying a complex web of rules long exploited by big corporations.

title: Jacinda Arden appears to call New Zealand opposition leader a 'Karen' during hate speech debate
description: A hate speech debate turned heated in New Zealand's Parliament on Wednesday when Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern suggested the country's opposition leader was a "Karen."

title: William and Harry reunite at Diana statue unveiling
description: Princes William and Harry put aside their differences to appear together Thursday to unveil a statue honoring their mother, Diana, Princess of Wales, in the Sunken Garden of Kensington Palace.

title: Astronomy Photographer of the Year 2021 shortlist revealed
description: Breathtaking images of a lavender field lit up by the Milky Way, a panorama of Iceland's Northern Lights over a frozen estuary, and a hazy sunrise in Shanghai are among those shortlisted for this year's 2021's Astronomy Photographer of the Year competition.

title: The dangerous messaging from Trump's insurrectionists about who's American and who isn't
description: A version of this story appeared in CNN's Race Deconstructed newsletter. To get it in your inbox every week, sign up for free here.

title: Eastern Europe was once a world leader on gay rights. Then it ran out of scapegoats
description: Martón Pál feels like he is in a parallel universe.

title: Russian military targeted passwords in wide-ranging hacking campaign, US and UK officials say
description: For months, Russian military hackers have engaged in a campaign to compromise the passwords of people employed in sensitive jobs at hundreds of organizations worldwide including US and European government and military agencies, US and British national security officials said Thursday.

title: This is what Bezos' trip to space will look like
description: Jeff Bezos has announced that he and his brother will be on board his company Blue Origin's first crewed mission to space. The capsule known as New Shepard is set to launch on July 20th.

title: Millions of girls and women are still held back because of periods
description: For most women in rich countries, getting their period doesn't amount to much more than a minor inconvenience. A few hours of cramps. Mood swings. Hiding a tampon up the sleeve on the way to the office bathroom. Yet for millions across the world, menstruation still remains synonymous with shame, hardship and missing out on life.

title: Don Cheadle and Bridgid Coulter got married during the pandemic
description: Don Cheadle revealed that he got married during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Foreign countries that 'bully' China will meet a 'great wall of steel,' says Xi during Communist Party centenary
Mama bear takes a swim in backyard pool with her cubs
description: As temperatures soared during a recent heat wave in North America, bears in Canada and California were seen taking a swim during the harsh conditions.

title: Hear Bill Cosby's comments to CNN following release
description: Bill Cosby, the first high-profile celebrity criminal trial of the #MeToo era, was released from prison after three years when Pennsylvania's highest court said his due process rights were violated over the course of his prosecution.

title: Turkey formally quits treaty to prevent violence against women
description: Turkey officially withdrew on Thursday from an international treaty to prevent violence against women, enacting a decision that drew condemnation from many Turks and Western allies when President Tayyip Erdogan announced it in March.

title: Euro 2020: Belgium vs. Italy headlines enthralling quarterfinals
description: The Euro 2020 round of 16 clashes provided some of the greatest entertainment the European Championships have ever seen.

title: Gap to close all stores in UK and Ireland
description: Gap will close all 81 of its stores in the United Kingdom and Ireland by the end of September and go fully online, as the brand adjusts to changes in shopping habits following the pandemic.

title: Does spinach make you strong? Ask Popeye -- and science
description: If you were a kid raised anytime between the 1930s and the 1970s -- or raised by someone who was raised then -- chances are good that you grew up with the idea that spinach was a muscle builder par excellence.

title: Judge denies request to remove Britney Spears' father as her co-conservator
description: A Los Angeles Superior Court judge denied on Wednesday a motion to remove Britney Spears' father from his role as a conservator of his daughter's $60 million estate, making official a November request to allow a trust to act as co-conservator of her estate.

title: There's a growing call for Iran to be banned from the Olympics
description: Athletes are trained to be tough; they've learned to push through the pain barrier and find courage when all hope might seem to be lost.

title: Thailand's most popular island reopens to vaccinated international travelers
description: For the first time in over 15 months, Thailand's popular resort island of Phuket is allowing vaccinated international travelers to enter without quarantine restrictions.

title: China's ruling Communist Party celebrates centennial in Tiananmen Square
description: The Chinese Communist Party marks its 100th anniversary with celebrations across the country. CNN's Steven Jiang reports from the Tiananmen Square in Beijing.

title: CNN reporter booed after asking Trump to apologize for riot
description: CNN's Jim Acosta was booed after he asked former President Donald Trump if he would apologize for the January 6 insurrection during a visit to the southern border.

title: Dancing robot teams up with K-pop band BTS
description: Spot, the Boston Dynamics robot dog, meets BTS and dances to their music in a "creepily awesome" video. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.

title: US veterans launch dig for missing WWII airmen in England
description: A team of US veterans have begun digging up a field in England in the hope of finding the remains of three missing airmen -- 77 years after their deaths in World War Two.
